spi_flash_MX25L1606E.c
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00002  * @file    spi_flash_MX25L1606E.c
00003  * @version $Rev:: 46           $
00004  * @date    $Date:: 2015-11-18 #$
00005  * @brief   This file provides a set of functions needed to manage the
00006  *          communication between SPI peripheral and SPI MX25L1606E FLASH.
00007  *************************************************************************************************************
00008  * @attention
00009  *

00038   * @brief The SPI Flash Driver with auto detection function.
00039   * @{

00044 /** @defgroup SPI_FLASH_AUTO_Exported_Functions SPI_FLASH_AUTO exported functions
00045   * @{
00046   */
00047 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00048   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH with a single WRITE cycle.
00049   * @param  WriteBuffer : pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00050   * @param  WriteAddr : FLASH's internal address to write to.
00051   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00052   * @retval None
00053   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00054 void MX25L1606E_PageWrite(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte)
00055 {
00056   /* Enable the write access to the FLASH                                                                   */
00057   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable_0();
00058 
00059   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00060   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00061   /* Send "Page Program" instruction                                                                        */
00062   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(MX25L1606E_CMD_WRITE);
00063   /* Send high byte address of WriteAddr                                                                    */
00064   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((WriteAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00065   /* Send medium byte address of WriteAddr                                                                  */
00066   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((WriteAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00067   /* Send low byte address of WriteAddr                                                                     */
00068   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(WriteAddr & 0xFF);
00069 
00070   while (NumOfWriteByte--)
00071   {
00072     /* Send the current byte                                                                                */
00073     SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(*WriteBuffer);
00074     /* Point on the next byte to be written                                                                 */
00075     WriteBuffer++;
00076   }
00077 
00078   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00079   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00080 
00081   /* Wait the end of Flash writing                                                                          */
00082   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd_0();
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00086   * @brief  Writes block of data to the FLASH.
00087   * @param  WriteBuffer: pointer to the buffer  containing the data to be written to the FLASH.
00088   * @param  WriteAddr: FLASH's internal address to write to.
00089   * @param  NumOfWriteByte : number of bytes to write to the FLASH.
00090   * @retval None
00091   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00092 void MX25L1606E_BufferWrite(u8* WriteBuffer, u32 WriteAddr, u32 NumOfWriteByte)
00093 {
00094   int i;
00095   u16 first_size, last_size, page_num;
00096 
00097   first_size = (MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE - (WriteAddr % MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE)) % MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE;
00098 
00099   if (first_size < NumOfWriteByte)
00100   {
00101     NumOfWriteByte -= first_size;
00102     page_num  = NumOfWriteByte / MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE;
00103     last_size = NumOfWriteByte % MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE;
00104   }
00105   else
00106   {
00107     first_size = NumOfWriteByte;
00108     page_num = 0;
00109     last_size = 0;
00110   }
00111 
00112   if (first_size)
00113   {
00114     MX25L1606E_PageWrite(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, first_size);
00115     WriteAddr += first_size;
00116     WriteBuffer += first_size;
00117   }
00118 
00119   for (i = 0; i < page_num; i++)
00120   {
00121     MX25L1606E_PageWrite(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE);
00122     WriteAddr += MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE;
00123     WriteBuffer += MX25L1606E_PAGESIZE;
00124   }
00125 
00126   if (last_size)
00127   {
00128     MX25L1606E_PageWrite(WriteBuffer, WriteAddr, last_size);
00129   }
00130 }
